intro: Senecio johnstonii var. ligulatus, commonly known as the Johnston's ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a rosette growth form with basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Senecio johnstonii var. ligulatus is considered a rare and endemic species, often found in specific regions of California and Nevada.
